data.title: The Vitality of Leadership Inside of Company Growth with Jim Obsitnik at SourceScrub
data.meta_description: The vitality of leadership is paramount in driving and sustaining company growth. Leaders who understand the vitality of leadership prioritize nurturing talent, fostering innovation, and adapting to changing business landscapes. Today's guest is Jim Obsitnik, CEO at SourceScrub. Inc Magazine ranked his company #1580 on the 2022 Inc 5000 list. SourceScrub is a market-leading Deal Sourcing Platform that equips dealmakers with deal-ready data, purpose-built tools, and on-demand data operations so they never miss a deal. In this episode, Jim talks about the vitality of leadership inside of company growth. Join us as we explore real-world examples, practical strategies, and expert insights on how the vitality of leadership influences every facet of company growth. Discover how dynamic leadership drives employee engagement, shapes company culture, and propels innovation, ultimately shaping the trajectory of an organization towards greater heights.
data.text:
The vitality of leadership is paramount in driving and sustaining company growth. Leaders who understand the vitality of leadership prioritize nurturing talent, fostering innovation, and adapting to changing business landscapes. Today’s guest is Jim Obsitnik, CEO at SourceScrub. Inc Magazine ranked his company #1580 on the 2022 Inc 5000 list. SourceScrub is a market-leading Deal Sourcing Platform that equips dealmakers with deal-ready data, purpose-built tools, and on-demand data operations so they never miss a deal. In this episode, Jim talks about the vitality of leadership inside of company growth. Join us as we explore real-world examples, practical strategies, and expert insights on how the vitality of leadership influences every facet of company growth. Discover how dynamic leadership drives employee engagement, shapes company culture, and propels innovation, ultimately shaping the trajectory of an organization towards greater heights.

Don't miss an episode. Subscribe to Growth Think Tank.

Jim Obsitnik: The Transcript

About: Senior Executive with Wharton MBA / Princeton BSEE and 30 years experience in building organizations to successfully commercialize Internet-based B2B software solutions, create platform-based ecosystems, and capitalize on emerging technology trends (SaaS, Cloud Computing, AI/ML, RPA). Excellent track record in growing profitable businesses for varied industry verticals (e.g. healthcare, logistics, retail, automotive, financial services, manufacturing, associations/non-profits) and customer segments (large enterprises, mid-market corporations, SMBs) ultimately leading to successful liquidity events: Netscape (IPO), Commerce One (IPO), Navis (acquired by Zebra), Everdream (acquired by Dell), Taleo (acquired by Oracle), & Capsilon (acquired by Ellie Mae). Strong, team-oriented management, servant leadership-based skills effective in building and developing diverse, agile international teams that focus on results, collaboration, transparency, and continued career growth.

Share the LOVE and TWEET about this episode.

Disclaimer: This transcript was created using YouTube’s translator tool and that may mean that some of the words, grammar, and typos come from a misinterpretation of the video.
